data.title: Find Living Relatives
data.text:
Hi

I am trying to find living relative's of Dorothy R Appleby, Dennis E Appleby ,Margaret O Appleby , Iris V Appleby, Jessie R Appleby.

Their father and mother name was Arthur Appleby and Sarah Tomlins and they lived in Surrey and Islington and St Pancras.

The family story is interesting as Arthurs Appleby's Uncle was paid to leave the family at the age of 22 so somewhere out there is a whole family I am related to.

If you can help or want more info on dates of birth etc please contact me

depending on the birth years cant you post some info

we cant help with just names

Have you tried looking in members trees to see if anyone has them listed

you could then try to make contact by sensing a message through the find out more box

Name: Jessie Rosina Raynor

Arrival Age: 25

Birth Date: abt 1900

Port of Departure: St John, New Brunswick, Canada

Arrival Date: 18 Dec 1925

Port of Arrival: Southampton, England

Ship Name: Melita

Shipping Line: Canadian Pacific Line

Official Number: 136367

Search Ship Database: Search for the Melita in the 'Passenger Ships and Images' database

with two sons Lawrence aged 2 1/2 and stanley aged 6 months

going to home address 29 Dartmouth Parkhill Highgate

went back 2 months later

Name: Jessie Rayner

Gender: Female

Arrival Age: 26

Birth Year: abt 1900

Birth Country: England

Departure Port: Southampton, England

Arrival Date: 27 Mar 1926

Arrival Port: St John, New Brunswick, Canada

Vessel: Minnedosa

Search Ship Database: Search for the Minnedosa in the 'Passenger Ships and Images' database

lawrence aged 3 Stanley aged 8 months both born Morse Saskatchewan

husband C C Raynor in tobacco trade of Morse Saskatchewan

Wow thank you for all the info so quickly.

I am still getting my head round this site I have a lot of their info dates of birth etc on the tree that I have done but you have found so much more thank you. I need to get my tree out and look.

If you could PM Iris`s daughter that would be great.

Walter Charles Appleby ( my great grandfather) born 1874 was paid to leave we suspect it was something to do with his son Reginald and the mother, it was never spoken about. He went to New York but didn't stay long ( I found him on the passenger list) You have named on here some of his brothers and sisters which is great. My father John Appleby is still alive and living in Blackpool he also has a living brother Graham.

I will write to Mrs Appleby and enclose some info.

I will write to Jessie
